episodeTitle: Peace Interrupted! A Navy Vice Admiral with a Fist of Love!
description: Following the traumatic events at Enies Lobby, the Straw Hat Pirates rest in Water 7 while their new ship undergoes construction. Their peace is shattered when Marine Vice-Admiral Garp arrives and attacks Luffy, revealing himself to be Luffy's grandfather.

events.title: Straw Hats Rest at Water 7
events.description: Following their victory at Enies Lobby and the loss of the Going Merry, the Straw Hat crew recovers in special quarters at Galley-La headquarters in Water 7.
events.significance: Sets the stage for the Post-Enies Lobby arc and shows the crew recovering from their traumatic experiences.

events.title: Kokoro and Family Visit
events.description: Kokoro arrives at the Straw Hats' quarters with Chimney, Yokozuna, and Gonbe to check on the crew and discuss Water 7's recovery from Aqua Laguna.
events.significance: Shows the bonds formed between the Straw Hats and Water 7 citizens, and provides information about the city's rebuilding efforts.

events.title: Luffy Eats While Sleeping
events.description: Luffy demonstrates his incredible appetite by continuing to eat ravenously even while asleep, showcasing his unique eating habits.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief and reinforces Luffy's character traits during the recovery period.

events.title: Treasure Tree Adam Revelation
events.description: Franky reveals his plan to build the Straw Hats' new ship using wood from the legendary Treasure Tree Adam, the same rare material used in Gol D. Roger's ship. He explains that Adam wood is among the strongest in the world and costs 200 million berries.
events.significance: Establishes the foundation for the Thousand Sunny's construction and connects to the Pirate King's legacy. The revelation that Franky used the stolen money to purchase this legendary material demonstrates his commitment to the crew.

quotes.text: I'm going to build them a dream ship using the Treasure Tree Adam!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky reveals his plans for the new ship

events.title: Adam Wood Arrives in Water 7
events.description: Zambai calls Franky to inform him that the Adam wood has finally arrived in Water 7. This rare and precious material appeared on the black market and was purchased with the 200 million berries Franky had stolen from the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Marks a crucial step toward building the Thousand Sunny. The arrival of this legendary material enables Franky to fulfill his dream of building a ship worthy of the crew.

events.title: Michael and Hoichael Debut
events.description: Two young delinquents from Water 7's backstreets, Michael and Hoichael, attempt to mug Zoro. They are Franky fanboys who dress like him and have extensive criminal records involving vandalism and shoplifting.
events.significance: An anime-original scene that adds local color to Water 7 and demonstrates Zoro's awareness of approaching danger.

events.title: Garp Arrives at Water 7
events.description: Marine Vice-Admiral Monkey D. Garp arrives at Water 7 with a fleet of Marine ships, bringing Koby and Helmeppo with him. His arrival marks the beginning of a major confrontation.
events.significance: The arrival of a Marine Vice-Admiral, especially one connected to Luffy's family, creates tension and sets up major revelations about Luffy's heritage.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo Reunite with Luffy
events.description: Koby and Helmeppo, now trained Marines under Garp, arrive at Water 7. Luffy and Zoro are shocked by Koby's transformation, barely recognizing him, while they don't recognize Helmeppo at all.
events.significance: Shows the parallel growth of Koby and Helmeppo alongside the Straw Hats. Their reunion demonstrates how far both groups have come since their first meeting.

events.title: Garp's 'Fist of Love' Awakens Luffy
events.description: Garp punches through the wall of Galley-La headquarters and strikes the sleeping Luffy with his 'Fist of Love.' To everyone's shock, Luffy feels pain despite his rubber body, screaming in agony from the blow.
events.significance: First demonstration of the 'Fist of Love' technique, which can bypass Luffy's Devil Fruit immunity through what Garp claims is 'love' (though it's likely Armament Haki). Shows that Luffy is not invincible against powerful Marines.

quotes.text: No one can escape my Fist of Love!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: After punching Luffy and causing him pain

events.title: Garp Revealed as Luffy's Grandfather
events.description: After Garp attacks him, Luffy casually addresses Garp as 'Gramps,' shocking the entire Straw Hat crew, the Marines, and viewers. Garp is revealed to be Luffy's paternal grandfather, a legendary Marine Vice-Admiral known as 'Garp the Fist' and 'Hero of the Marines.'
events.significance: A massive revelation that explains part of Luffy's heritage and adds complexity to his journey as a pirate. The fact that the grandson of a Marine hero became a pirate creates dramatic irony and foreshadows future family revelations.

quotes.text: No one can escape my Fist of Love!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: After demonstrating his ability to hurt Luffy

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Casually revealing Garp's relationship to the shocked crew

quotes.text: I'm going to build them a dream ship using the Treasure Tree Adam!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Revealing his plans for the Straw Hats' new ship

themes.description: The episode explores the complex relationship between Luffy and his Marine grandfather, highlighting how family ties transcend professional duties and personal choices.
themes.symbolism: Garp's 'Fist of Love' represents the complicated nature of family bonds - simultaneously violent and caring, disciplinary yet affectionate.

themes.description: Franky's dedication to building the perfect ship using legendary materials demonstrates the lengths craftsmen go to achieve their dreams, paralleling the Straw Hats' own journey.
themes.symbolism: The Treasure Tree Adam represents the foundation of dreams - rare, valuable, and requiring sacrifice to obtain.

themes.description: The episode focuses on the crew's need to rest and prepare after traumatic events, acknowledging that even the strongest need time to heal.
themes.symbolism: Water 7's rebuilding after Aqua Laguna mirrors the crew's own recovery process.

characterSpotlights.development: Garp is revealed as Luffy's grandfather, a legendary Marine Vice-Admiral who can hurt Luffy despite his rubber body. His casual yet forceful approach to family demonstrates his unique personality.

Punches through wall to reach Luffy

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's casual acknowledgment of Garp as his grandfather shocks everyone, showing how nonchalant he is about things others find earth-shattering. He's vulnerable to Garp's attacks despite his Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Gets punched by Garp and feels pain

characterSpotlights.development: Franky reveals his commitment to the Straw Hats by using the stolen money to purchase legendary Adam wood, demonstrating his dedication to building them the perfect ship.
keyActions: Receives call about Adam wood arrival
quotes: I'm going to build them a dream ship using the Treasure Tree Adam!

characterSpotlights.development: Koby appears as a trained Marine under Garp, shocking Luffy with his transformation. His growth parallels Luffy's own development.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added a scene where Michael and Hoichael attempt to mug Zoro, which was only referenced in the manga but not shown.
Extended scenes of the crew resting and Kokoro's visit are expanded in the anime for pacing.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode of the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, which serves as a cooldown period after the intense Enies Lobby battle.
According to Oda, Garp's 'Fist of Love' can hurt Luffy not because of Haki, but because of 'love' itself, though many fans believe it's actually Armament Haki.
The Treasure Tree Adam is the same material used to build Gol D. Roger's ship, Oro Jackson.
This episode adapts primarily Chapter 431 of the manga, titled 'Fist of Love.'
Garp had appeared previously in Episode 68, but this is the first time his relationship to Luffy is revealed in the anime.
From episode 279 onwards, One Piece stopped airing ending themes. Episode 313 only features the opening 'Crazy Rainbow.'
